channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [WFLY-183] Concurrent cache start causes NPE in MarshallerFactory with Infinispan 5.2.1.Final
item.description:
After 5.2.1.Final upgrade an NPE was spotted in org.jboss.as.test.integration.jpa.secondlevelcache.JPA2LCTestCase

[0m[31m16:22:36,784 ERROR [org.jboss.msc.service.fail] (ServerService Thread Pool -- 77) MSC00001: Failed to start service jboss.persistenceunit."jpa_SecondLevelCacheTestCase.jar#mypc2": org.jboss.msc.service.StartException in service jboss.persistenceunit."jpa_SecondLevelCacheTestCase.jar#mypc2": javax.persistence.PersistenceException: [PersistenceUnit: mypc2] Unable to build EntityManagerFactory
 
	at org.jboss.as.jpa.service.PersistenceUnitServiceImpl$1.run(PersistenceUnitServiceImpl.java:103)
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886) [rt.jar:1.6.0_29]
 
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908) [rt.jar:1.6.0_29]
 
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:662) [rt.jar:1.6.0_29]
 
	at org.jboss.threads.JBossThread.run(JBossThread.java:122)
 
Caused by: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: [PersistenceUnit: mypc2] Unable to build EntityManagerFactory
 
	at org.hibernate.ejb.Ejb3Configuration.buildEntityManagerFactory(Ejb3Configuration.java:915)
 
	at org.hibernate.ejb.Ejb3Configuration.buildEntityManagerFactory(Ejb3Configuration.java:890)
 
	at org.hibernate.ejb.HibernatePersistence.createContainerEntityManagerFactory(HibernatePersistence.java:74)

	at org.jboss.as.jpa.service.PersistenceUnitServiceImpl.access$600(PersistenceUnitServiceImpl.java:57)
 
	at org.jboss.as.jpa.service.PersistenceUnitServiceImpl$1.run(PersistenceUnitServiceImpl.java:99)
 
	... 4 more
 
Caused by: org.hibernate.service.spi.ServiceException: Unable to create requested service [org.hibernate.engine.spi.CacheImplementor]
 
	at org.hibernate.service.internal.AbstractServiceRegistryImpl.createService(AbstractServiceRegistryImpl.java:186)
 
	at org.hibernate.service.internal.AbstractServiceRegistryImpl.initializeService(AbstractServiceRegistryImpl.java:150)

https://gist.github.com/rhusar/5040146
item.summary: Concurrent cache start causes NPE in MarshallerFactory with Infinispan 5.2.1.Final

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I have traced down that the problem started appearing due to this commit in Infinispan:

https://github.com/infinispan/infinispan/commit/f0beece095acb273a18bbef05d03cf9949d6b19b

which after restructure now throws NPE.
Moreover we have confirmed that defineConfiguration is not thread-safe which might be causing the issue since we are configuring 3 caches at once.

Let's open an ISPN jira to fix the thread safety of defineConfiguration(). This definitely needs to be fixed, because web/ejb/jpa deployments create cache configurations, and these have to be definable in a thread safe way.
We can workaround this for now by making the defineConfiguration(...) methods of our EmbeddedCacheManager wrapper synchronized.

Scott Marlow <smarlow@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

I added a question mark to the jboss‑eap‑6.1.0, that should be changed to a plus sign operator since this concurrency regression should be fixed in the next EAP 6.1 build.

Scott Marlow <smarlow@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

I added "+" devel_ack to flags. I'm adding these verbose comments so we can figure out who did what (in case Bugzilla doesn't keep a history). If we don't need to be this verbose, I'll stop.

Randall Hauch <rhauch@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

ModeShape (which will be in EDS/SOA/BRMS 6.0) needs this to be fixed in EAP 6.1.0. It is a BLOCKER for us.

In our testing, at least one Infinispan cache fails to start up around 50-75% of the time when simply defining the caches in "standalone.xml" and starting the server. This results in the corresponding ModeShape repository being completely unavailable.

Radoslav Husar <rhusar@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

To be fixed by https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=918562
Workaround reverted, long term fix – Infinispan upgrade (https://github.com/jbossas/jboss-as/pull/4214) – was merged.

Radoslav Husar <rhusar@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

Fix is present in EAP 6.1 release. Should have been moved to ON_QA, moving now.
Radoslav Husar <rhusar@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 918118 from ASSIGNED to ON_QA
Jitka Kudrnacova <jkudrnac@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 918118 from ON_QA to VERIFIED

Jitka Kudrnacova <jkudrnac@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

Verified.

Scott Mumford <smumford@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

Is it possible to get the basic info for a release note provided?

I've reviewed https://issues.jboss.org/browse/WFLY-183 and I'm unable to discern enough info to start a draft.

The skeleton info-points are defined in the "Doc Text" field above.
Radoslav Husar <rhusar@redhat.com> changed the Status of bug 918118 from VERIFIED to CLOSED

Radoslav Husar <rhusar@redhat.com> made a comment on bug 918118

Everything was done for 6.1.0. Someone just forgot to clear the flags, so doing that now.
